page.title: 20Menwith U.S.A.- Kettlesing
page.content: Menwith Hill Station is a U.S. town in miniature, planted firmly in the heart of the Yorkshire Dales. The majority of U.S. citizens appear to thoroughly enjoy and appreciate their stay here, in particular, commenting favourably upon the slower, quieter life style; the beauty of the Dales; the abundance of historical sites; the friendliness of the people; and affordable cultural facilities of neighbouring towns. Disadvantages, although minimal, include inconvenient retailing hours, lack of choice on TV/radio, explicit scenes in early evening TV, food differences, and erratic driving. Most have found adjustment to Brit- ish life styles easier than anticipat- ed, and, indeed, there have been a number of U.S./U.K. marriages includ- ing the current station chief.
